name: Sharp-skinned Hawk
text:
Keep a look out for any of these species!

Usually 25 to 36 centimeters with a width of 53 centimeters.It is about the size of a jay and is very fast. The Sharp-shinned Hawk has a long narrow square tipped tail, and short rounded wings.The adult is slate grey with a pale bottom. The barring is a fine rust color. Immature birds are brown on top with creamy white bottom. The barring appears on the chest and wings.
